subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Vulgar Voices
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Besides Pebbles Flintstone?

F-S

On Sat, Oct 9, 2010 at 12:18 PM, Tim <sir_tim1@...> wrote:

>
>
> frank, there is also a person (girl) who they call pebbles also. she has a
> nice voice too.
>
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> > "Coincidentally" they're talking about pebbles.
> >
> > F-S
> >
> > On Sat, Oct 9, 2010 at 12:09 AM, Frank Sumption
> > <purplealiengirl@...>wrote:
>
> >
> > > I used to get alot of that stuff, I usually listen form tape, and when
> > > they were really obnoxious I would just back the tape up and record
> over the
> > > bad voice. I don't how it works, but it stops them cold. They don't
> come
> > > back and keep harassing. I tolerate some cussing an name calling, I can
> out
> > > cuss any of them!
> > >
> > > They probably find other ways to pull tricks, which is why I don't any
> > > information as gospel from the boxes, and I laugh at the experts that
> think
> > > they have it all figured out.
> > >
> > > There's a thing from India--I think--the spirits throw pebbles at
> people
> > > walking along the paths at night to put a little fear in the people.
> With
> > > boxes, they also throw pebbles--and "they" tell me they throw pebbles.
> It's
> > > like a game or something.
> > >
> > > F-S
> > >
> > > On Fri, Oct 8, 2010 at 3:28 PM, Adriana Jones <adrianamjones@...>wrote:
>
>
> > >
> > >>
> > >>
> > >> Thanks guys for the advice, I was a little bit distressed at first
> upon
> > >> hearing those things, but I feel a little bit better now... and armed
> with
> > >> advice on how to handle it next time... I also found someone say the
> f-word
> > >> now too, but I'll know how to handle it better now. Should I post the
> vulgar
> > >> files up on here, as proof, or should I leave them off this group, for
> being
> > >> vulgar? Frank? Anyone? Please let me know.
> > >>
> > >>
> > >> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> <EVP-ITC%
> 40yahoogroups.com>, "Adriana
>
> > >> Jones" <adrianamjones@> wrote:
> > >> >
> > >> > I know that there are many spirits who are vulgar, malicious, liars,
> > >> troublemakers, etc. Last night I did my first ghost box session alone,
> (my
> > >> second session overall - or third if I count the synth voice box
> session).
> > >> During the session, I was feeling a little bit self-conscious and
> > >> discouraged, not sure if it would work for me alone, etc. so my mood
> was a
> > >> little down, maybe negative.... also I'm a relatively young female
> (28). I'm
> > >> wondering if its due to those two factors that I received - upon going
> back
> > >> to listen to the recorded session (I'll try to post files up later for
> > >> confirmation)... a series of unwelcoming and vulgar messages... toward
> the
> > >> beginning of the session someone said "you're too young" and then a
> while
> > >> into it I got "h* cheats, hit me hit me hit me hit me"... and then
> toward
> > >> the end of the session I got "a**hole". (Frank, please let me know if
> I've
> > >> crossed the line as far as posting up vulgar words on this group - not
> sure
> > >> how else to discuss my session, lol... and I do apologize)
> > >> >
> > >> > So here's the thing, I can alter my attitude, to be more positive,
> but I
> > >> can't alter my age and gender... so any other females get vulgar
> messages
> > >> like this? And what can I do about it? What should I say? I really
> have no
> > >> desire to continue with these sessions if this is how I get treated...
> I
> > >> guess I was an easy target, just starting out with the ghost box, and
> not
> > >> being a confident type, I'm a shy, timid, walk-all-over-me type too
> > >> often.... how do I "administer discipline" in this situation? Does it
> work
> > >> to just tell them to please stop it, or that you're not welcome if you
> don't
> > >> behave, etc? Or does that only egg them on further? Help!
> > >> >
> > >>
> > >>
> > >>
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>  
>

Besides Pebbles Flin s one?
 
F-S
